text: The arrondissement of La Tour-du-Pin is an arrondissement of France. It is part of the Isère département, Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes region. Its capital, and a subprefecture of the department, is the city of La Tour-du-Pin. ==History== When the Isère department was created in 1790, the arrondissement of La Tour- du-Pin was part of that original department. ==Geography== The arrondissement of La Tour-du-Pin is bordered to the north and northeast by the Ain department, to the east by the Savoie department, to the south by the arrondissement of Grenoble, to the west by the arrondissement of Vienne, and to the northwest by the Rhône department. It is in the northeast of the department and is the second largest arrondissement with an area of , and the second in population with 270,681 inhabitants and a density of inhabitants/km². ==Composition== ===Cantons=== After the reorganisation of the cantons in France, cantons are not subdivisions of the arrondissements so they could have communes that belong to different arrondissements. In the arrondissement of La Tour-du-Pin there are 8 cantons: # Bourgoin-Jallieu (3802) # Chartreuse-Guiers (3803) (partly) # Charvieu-Chavagneux (3804) # Le Grand-Lemps (3808) (partly) # L’Isle-d'Abeau (3814) (partly) #
